endemo2.input_and_settings package

Submodules

endemo2.input_and_settings.control_parameters module

This module contains the in-model representation of all settings found in Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx

class ControlParameters(general_settings, industry_settings, cts_settings, hh_settings, transport_settings)[source]

Bases: object

The ControlParameter class holds the data given by the Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx file. It is split in general settings, and settings for each sector, indicating non-overlapping parameters for our model.

Variables:

  • general_settings (GeneralSettings) – The settings contained in the “GeneralSettings”-sheet.

  • industry_settings (IndustrySettings) – The settings contained in the “IND_*”-sheets.

Parameters:

  • general_settings (GeneralSettings) –

  • industry_settings (IndustrySettings) –

  • cts_settings (CtsSettings) –

  • hh_settings (HouseholdSettings) –

  • transport_settings (TransportSettings) –

class CtsSettings(df_cts)[source]

Bases: object

The CtsSettings contain the parameters for the model given in Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx in the CTS sheet.

Parameters:

df_cts (DataFrame) – The CTS sheet of Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx

Variables:

  • trend_calc_for_spec (ScForecastMethod) – Sets the forecast method to extrapolate the specific consumption in the cts sector.

  • nuts2_distribution_per_pop_density (bool) – Indicates whether the nuts2 distribution should be done by population density or employee percentages.

  • skip_years ([int]) – These years are skipped in historical data.

  • last_available_year (int) – Years after that are not included in calculations.

  • heat_levels (Heat) – How heat should be distributed among different heat levels.

  • heat_substitution (dict[DemandType, Heat]) – The amount of heat that can be substituted by electricity or hydrogen.

map_sc_forecast_method = {'0': ScForecastMethod.CONST_MEAN, '1': ScForecastMethod.LINEAR, '2': ScForecastMethod.LOGARITHMIC, '3': ScForecastMethod.CONST_LAST}
class GeneralSettings(ex_general, ex_country)[source]

Bases: object

The GeneralSettings contain the parameters for the model given in Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx in the GeneralSettings and Countries sheets.

Parameters:

  • ex_general (pd.DataFrame) – The dataframe of the “GeneralSettings”-sheet in Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx

  • ex_country (pd.DataFrame) – The dataframe of the “Countries”-sheet in Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx

Variables:

  • _sectors_active_values (dict[str, bool]) – Contains information, whether a sector is activ, as indicated by the settings.

  • _parameter_values (dict[str, bool]) – Holds the values from the GeneralSettings table in a dictionary {Parameter_string -> bool}

  • target_year (int) – This is the year, the model makes predictions for.

  • recognized_countries ([str]) – This is the list of countries_in_group that are in the “Countries”-sheet of Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx

  • active_countries ([str]) – This is the list of active countries_in_group. Only for these countries_in_group, calculations are performed.

  • nuts2_version (int) – The version of NUTS2 used for reading the files that hold information per NUTS2 Region. Currently, it should be either 2016 or 2021.

  • toggle_hourly_forecast (bool) – Indicates whether to distribute demand over hours according to load profiles.

  • toggle_nuts2_resolution (bool) – Indicates whether to distribute demand over nuts2 regions.

  • toggle_graphical_output (bool) – Indicates whether to generate visual output.

get_active_sectors()[source]
Returns:

The list of transport activated for calculation.

Return type:

[SectorIdentifier]

Variables:

name – The parameter name in the table.

Return type:

Any

Returns:

The parameter value by parameter name with meaningful error message.

Parameters:

name (str) –

sector_id_map = {'Sector: commertial, trade, services': SectorIdentifier.COMMERCIAL_TRADE_SERVICES, 'Sector: households': SectorIdentifier.HOUSEHOLDS, 'Sector: industry': SectorIdentifier.INDUSTRY, 'Sector: transport': SectorIdentifier.TRANSPORT}
class HouseholdSettings(df_hh)[source]

Bases: object

The HouseholdSettings contain the parameters for the model given in Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx in the HH sheet.

Parameters:

df_hh (DataFrame) – The HH sheet of Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx

Variables:

  • heat_levels (Heat) – How heat should be distributed among different heat levels.

  • single_households_share (float) – The percentage/100 of single households.

class IndustrySettings(df_general, df_subsectors)[source]

Bases: object

The IndustrySettings contain the parameters for the model given in Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx in the IND_general and IND_subsectors sheets.

Variables:

  • forecast_map (dict[str, ForecastMethod]) – Maps the forecast method string, used in the setting tables, to the internal enum representation.

  • forecast_method (ForecastMethod) – Contains the currently selected forecast method.

  • time_trend_model_activation_quadratic (bool) – “If the time trend model is deactivated, the traditional approach is selected”

  • production_quantity_calc_per_capita (bool) – Decides, whether the production quantity prognosis should use per-capita projection.

  • trend_calc_for_spec (bool) – Decides, whether specific consumption should be predicted from historical data, when available.

  • nuts2_distribution_based_on_installed_ind_capacity (bool) – “If false, distribution per population density.”

  • skip_years ([int]) – Years that are skipped while reading files, to remove outliers.

  • last_available_year (int) – Last year that’s read from historical production files (exclusive).

  • product_settings (dict[str, ProductSettings]) – Contains settings for each product. Of the form {front_label -> product_settings_obj}

  • active_product_names ([str]) – A list of the names of active products. Only for these products, calculations are performed.

  • rest_sector_growth_rate (float) – The growth rate of the rest sector.

  • use_gdp_as_x (bool) – Indicates that prediction x-axis should be gdp instead of time.

  • heat_substitution (dict[DemandType, Heat]) – The percentage/100 of heat that is substituted by another demand type. Is of form {demand_type -> heat_substitution}.

Parameters:

  • df_general (pd.DataFrame) –

  • df_subsectors (pd.DataFrame) –

forecast_map = {'Exponential': ForecastMethod.EXPONENTIAL, 'Linear GDP function': ForecastMethod.LINEAR, 'Linear time trend': ForecastMethod.LINEAR, 'Quadratic GDP function': ForecastMethod.QUADRATIC}
class ProductSettings(active, manual_exp_change_rate, perc_used, efficiency_improvement)

Bases: tuple

Alias for field number 0

Alias for field number 3

class TransportSettings(df_transport)[source]

Bases: object

The TransportSettings contain the parameters for the model given in Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx in the TRA sheet.

Parameters:

df_transport (DataFrame) – The TRA sheet of Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx

Variables:

  • split_method (TransportModalSplitMethod) – How the demand should be split among modals.

  • scenario_selection_final_energy_demand (str) – Scenario selection for final energy demand calculation - electricity and hydrogen vehicles shares based on reference case or user inputs

  • toggle_calculate_rest_subsector (bool) – Scenario selection for final energy demand calculation - electricity and hydrogen vehicles shares

  • ind_production_reference_year (int) – Freight transport is dependent on industrial production. Reference historical year selection.

map_final_energy_demand_scenario_to_enum = {'Reference': TransportFinalEnergyDemandScenario.REFERENCE, 'User-defined': TransportFinalEnergyDemandScenario.USER_DEFINED}
map_model_split_method_string_to_enum = {('Historical', 'Constant'): TransportModalSplitMethod.HISTORICAL_CONSTANT, ('Historical', 'Trend'): TransportModalSplitMethod.HISTORICAL_TIME_TREND, ('User-defined', 'Constant'): TransportModalSplitMethod.USER_DEFINED, ('User-defined', 'Trend'): TransportModalSplitMethod.USER_DEFINED}

endemo2.input_and_settings.input_cts module

class CtsInput(ctrl, cts_path)[source]

Bases: object

CtsInput denoted input that is read from the “input/industry” folder.

Parameters:

  • ctrl (ControlParameters) – The control parameters object.

  • cts_path (Path) – The path to the input files for the CTS sector.

Variables:

  • dict_employee_number_country (dict[str, dict[str, [Datapoint]) – Contains the number ob employees per subsector for every country. Is of form {country_name -> {subsector -> [Datapoint]}}

  • dict_employee_number_nuts2 (dict[str, dict[str, dict[str, [Datapoint]]) – Contains the number ob employees per subsector for every NUTS2 region. Is of form {country_name -> {nuts2_region -> {subsector -> [Datapoint]}}}

  • dict_employee_number_country_cts (dict[str, [Datapoint]]) – Contains the number of employees in the whole cts sector.

  • energy_carrier_consumption (dict[str, [Datapoint]]) – The historical quantity of energy carrier in subsector. Of form: {country_name -> {energy_carrier -> [Datapoint]}}

  • load_profile (dict[DemandType, Any]) – The load profile for the cts sector.

classmethod read_employee_per_subsector(ctrl, path_to_file, sheet_name)[source]

Reads employees per subsector from the Employee…xlsx input sheets

Parameters:

  • ctrl – The control Parameters

  • path_to_file (Path) – Path of the file that should be read.

  • sheet_name (str) – The name of the sheet that should be read.

Return type:

{}

Returns:

The data on number of employees in each subsector of form {region_name -> {subsector_name -> data}}, where region_name can be a country or a nuts2 region, depending on input file.

classmethod read_number_employees_cts(ctrl, path_to_file, sheet_name)[source]

Reads employees per subsector from the euro-stats input sheets.

Parameters:

  • ctrl (ControlParameters) – The control Parameters

  • path_to_file (Path) – Path of the file that should be read.

  • sheet_name (str) – The name of the sheet that should be read.

Return type:

dict[str, [<class ‘endemo2.data_structures.containers.Datapoint’>]]

Returns:

The data on number of employees (in thousands) in the whole cts sector of a country. Is of form {country_name -> data}.

subsector_names = ['Groß- und Einzelhandel', 'Private Büros', 'Hotel und Restaurants', 'Öffentliche Büros', 'Gesundheits- und Sozialwesen', 'Bildung', 'Sonstige']

This module is responsible for reading the input data form files. (except the Set_and_Control_Parameters. That would be in control_parameters.)

class GeneralInput(ctrl, path)[source]

Bases: object

General Input contains all preprocessing that is read from the “preprocessing/general” folder.

Parameters:

  • ctrl (ControlParameters) – The parsed Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx

  • path (Path) – The path to the preprocessing/general folder

Variables:

  • population (PopulationData) – All data from the population preprocessing.

  • gdp (dict[str, HisProg[[Datapoint], [Interval, float]]]) – The gdp for each country.

  • efficiency (dict[str, ("electricity", "heat")]) – The efficiency for each energy carrier.

  • efficiency_hh (dict[str, ("electricity", "heat")]) – The efficiency for each energy carrier using the households names.

  • nuts2_valid_regions (set) – The set of valid nuts2 regions within the selected NUTS2 code.

sc_historical_sheet_names = ['Feste fossile Brennstoffe', 'Synthetische Gase', 'Erdgas', 'Oel', 'Erneuerbare Energien', 'Abfaelle', 'Elektrizitaet', 'Waerme']
class PopulationInput(ctrl, nuts2_valid_regions, abbreviations, df_country_pop_his, df_country_pop_prog, df_nuts2_pop_his, df_nuts2_pop_prog)[source]

Bases: object

Holds all data on population. That includes historical data, prognosis data for each country and nuts2 region.

Parameters:

  • ctrl (ControlParameters) – The parsed Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx file.

  • nuts2_valid_regions (set) – The set of nuts2 regions that are recognized. They are used to filter the preprocessing data.

  • abbreviations (dict) – The countries_in_group abbreviations, used to access nuts2 data.

  • df_country_pop_his (pd.DataFrame) – The sheet containing data of population history per country.

  • df_country_pop_prog (pd.DataFrame) – The sheet containing the manual prognosis of population amount per country.

  • df_nuts2_pop_his (pd.DataFrame) – The sheet containing data of population history per NUTS2 region.

  • df_nuts2_pop_prog (pd.DataFrame) – The sheet containing the prognosis intervals and growth rate for nuts2 regions.

Variables:

  • country_population (dict[str, HisProg]) – Data for the population of whole countries_in_group. It is of the form historical:{country_name -> [Datapoint]}, prognosis:{country_name -> [Datapoint]}

  • nuts2_population (dict[str, [(str, [float, float])]]) – Data for the population of NUTS2 regions. It is of the form {country_name -> (code -> (historical: [(float,float)], prognosis: [interval, growth rate]))}

endemo2.input_and_settings.input_households module

class HouseholdsInput(ctrl, hh_path)[source]

Bases: object

The HouseholdInput is responsible for reading all input data related to the Households sector.

Variables:

  • historical_consumption (dict[str, dict[HouseholdsSubsectorId, dict[str, [Datapoint]]]]) – The historical energy consumption for each subsector in each country. Is of form {country_name -> {subsector_id -> {energy_carrier -> data}}}.

  • hw_dict_hot_water_per_person_per_day (dict[str, float]) – The amount of hot water per person per day in liter for each country. Is of form {country_name -> liters}.

  • hw_dict_hot_water_calibration (dict[str, float]) – The hot water calibration value for each country. Is of form {country_name -> calibration value}.

  • hw_specific_capacity (float) – The hot water specific capacity.

  • hw_outlet_temperature (float) – The hot water outlet temperature.

  • hw_inlet_temperature (dict[str, float]) – The hot water inlet temperature for each country. Is of form {country_name -> float}.

  • sh_specific_heat (dict[str, (Datapoint, float)]) – The specific heat forecast start point and change rate for each country. Is of form {country_name -> (start_point, change_rate)}

  • sh_area_per_household (dict[str, (Datapoint, float)]) – The area per household forecast start point and change rate for each country. Is of form {country_name -> (start_point, change_rate)}

  • sh_persons_per_household (HisProg(dict[str, [Datapoint]](), dict[str, [Datapoint]]())) – The datapoints for the persons per household in every year to interpolate between. Is of form {country_name -> [(year, value)]}.

  • hw_dict_space_heating_calibration (dict[str, float]) – The space heating calibration value for each country. Is of form {country_name -> calibration value}.

Parameters:

  • ctrl (ControlParameters) –

  • hh_path (Path) –

hh_energy_carrier_unit_conversion = {'derived heat': 0.0002777777777777778, 'electricity': 0.001, 'gas': 0.0002777777777777778, 'solid fossil fuels': 0.007821538148752638, 'total oil & petroleum products': 0.012002320102842252, 'total renew. & wastes': 0.0002777777777777778}
hh_his_sheets_skip_rows = [0, 1, 2, 3]
hh_input_sheet_names = {<HouseholdsSubsectorId.SPACE_HEATING: (0,)>: '1a_SpaceHeating', <HouseholdsSubsectorId.SPACE_COOLING: (1,)>: '1b_SpaceCooling', <HouseholdsSubsectorId.WATER_HEATING: (2,)>: '1c_WaterHeating', <HouseholdsSubsectorId.COOKING: (3,)>: '1d_Cooking', <HouseholdsSubsectorId.LIGHTING_AND_APPLIANCES: 4>: '1e_LightingAndAppliances', <HouseholdsSubsectorId.OTHER: 5>: '1f_OtherEndUses'}

endemo2.input_and_settings.input_industry module

class IndustryInput(ctrl, industry_path, nuts2_valid_regions, active_countries)[source]

Bases: object

Industry Input denoted input that is read from the “input/industry” folder.

Parameters:

  • ctrl (ControlParameters) – ControlSettings object.

  • industry_path (Path) – The path to the industry input folder.

  • nuts2_valid_regions (set[str]) – The valid nuts2 regions of set version.

  • active_countries ([<class 'str'>]) – The currently active countries.

Variables:

  • dict_product_input (dict[str, ProductInput]) – Stores the product specific preprocessing for all active products.

  • product_data_access (dict[str, Retrieve]) – Specify how data sheets for each product should be accessed

  • sc_historical_data_file_names (dict[str, str]) – The file names of the files used for certain products to read historical information on specific consumption.

  • sc_historical_sheet_names ([str]) – The sheet names for the files used to read historical information on specific consumption for certain products.

  • rest_sector_input (RestSectorInput) – All preprocessing data relating to the rest sector.

  • dict_electricity_profiles (dict[str, [float]]) – The hourly profiles for electricity demand for each country.

  • dict_heat_profiles (dict[SubsectorGroup, dict[str, [float]]]) – The hourly profiles for heat demand for each subsector group and each country. Is of form {subsector_group -> {back_label -> [hourly_profile in %/100]}}

  • subsector_to_group_map (dict[str, SubsectorGroup]) – Maps a certain subsector to their subsector group enum.

product_data_access = {'alu_prim': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'alu_sec': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'ammonia': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'ammonia_classic': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'aromate': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'aromate_classic': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'cement': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'chlorine': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'copper_prim': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'copper_sec': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'ethylene': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'ethylene_classic': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'glass': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'methanol': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'methanol_classic': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'paper': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'propylene': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'propylene_classic': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'steel': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'steel_direct': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'steel_prim': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>, 'steel_sec': <endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility.FileReadingHelper object>}

class ProductInput(product_name, industry_path, industry_settings, ex_specific_consumption, ex_bat, ex_nuts2_ic, ex_country_groups, active_countries, dict_heat_levels, nuts2_valid_regions)[source]

Bases: object

The ProductInput holds all input data that is specific to a subsector. Most of the input is also read within this class, except input that is more efficient to be read for all products at once. That input is read in the IndustryInput class.

Parameters:

  • product_name (str) – The name of the product this input is for.

  • industry_path (Path) – The path to the industry input folder.

  • industry_settings (IndustrySettings) – The settings for the industry sector.

  • ex_specific_consumption (ExcelFile) – The Excel sheet for specific consumption default values.

  • ex_bat (ExcelFile) – The Excel sheet for best available technology.

  • ex_nuts2_ic (ExcelFile) – The Excel sheet for nuts2 installed capacities.

  • ex_country_groups (ExcelFile) – The Excel sheet of the country groups.

  • active_countries ([str]) – The list of english names of the active countries.

  • dict_heat_levels (dict[str, endemo2.data_structures.containers.Heat]) – The dictionary holding the heat levels for all products. Of form {front_label -> heat_levels}.

  • dict_heat_levels –

  • nuts2_valid_regions (set[str]) –

Variables:

  • front_label (str) – The name of the product.

  • specific_consumption_default (dict[str, containers.SpecConsum]) – Default specific consumption value for this product.

  • specific_consumption_historical (dict[str, Datapoint]) – Historical specific consumption data for this product. Accessible per country.

  • bat (dict[str, containers.EH]) – The best-available-technology consumption for this product. Accessible per country.

  • production (dict[str, Datapoint]) – The historical amount data for this product. Accessible per country.

  • heat_levels (Heat) – How heat demand should be distributed across heat levels for this product.

  • manual_exp_change_rate (float) – If product amount projection will be calculated exponentially, this will be the change rate.

  • perc_used (float) – A scalar for the amount of a product. This is used to model modern technologies replacing old ones.

  • nuts2_installed_capacity (dict[str, dict[str, float]]) – Installed capacity in %/100 for each NUTS2 Region. Structure {country_name -> {nuts2_region_name -> capacity_value}}

  • country_groups (dict[str, [[str]]]) – Input from country group file, structured as {group_type -> list_of_groups}.

read_best_available_technology(ex_bat)[source]

Reads the specific consumption input of the best available technology.

Parameters:

ex_bat (ExcelFile) – The Excel file of the best available technology.

Return type:

dict[str, EH]

Returns:

The bat consumption for each country. Of the form: {back_label -> EH}

Parameters:

  • active_countries ([<class 'str'>]) – The list of active countries.

Return type:

dict[GroupType, [[<class ‘str’>]]]

Returns:

The country groups of form: {group_type -> [ grp1[country1, country2, …], grp2[country4, …], … ]}

Parameters:

industry_path (Path) – The path to the industry input folder.

Return type:

dict[str, [<class ‘endemo2.data_structures.containers.Datapoint’>]]

Returns:

read_nuts2_installed_capacities(ex_nuts2_ic, nuts2_valid_regions)[source]

Reads all the installed capacities for the nuts2 regions.

Parameters:

  • ex_nuts2_ic (ExcelFile) – The Excel sheet holding the installed capacities percentages.

  • nuts2_valid_regions (set[str]) – The valid nuts2 regions according to the currently chosen nuts2 version.

Return type:

dict[str, dict[str, float]]

Returns:

The installed capacities for all nuts2 regions in an active country. Is of form: {back_label -> {nuts2_region_name -> installed_capacity}}

endemo2.input_and_settings.input_manager module

class InputManager[source]

Bases: object

The InputManager class connects all types of preprocessing data, that is in the form of excel/csv sheets in the ‘preprocessing’ folder.

Variables:

  • super_path (str) – Path of project folder

  • input_path (str) – Path of preprocessing files

  • output_path (str) – Path for output files

  • general_path (str) – Path for preprocessing files in “general” folder

  • industry_path (str) – Path for preprocessing files in “industry” folder

  • ctrl (ControlParameters) – Holds all information received from Set_and_Control_Parameters.xlsx

  • general_input (GeneralInput) – Holds all information of the preprocessing files from the “preprocessing/general” folder.

  • industry_input (IndustryInput) – Holds all information of the preprocessing files from the “preprocessing/industry” folder.

class TransportInput(ctrl, traffic_path)[source]

Bases: object

CtsInput denoted input that is read from the “input/industry” folder.

Parameters:

  • ctrl (ControlParameters) – The control parameters object.

  • traffic_path (Path) – The path to the input files for the CTS sector.

Variables:

  • kilometres (dict[TrafficType, dict[str, dict[TransportModal, Datapoint]]]) – The number of (million) kilometres travelled in one year by one unit of traffic type. Is of form {traffic_type -> country_name -> transport_modal -> datapoint}.

  • modal_split_his (dict[TrafficType, dict[str, dict[TransportModal, [Datapoint]]]]) – The historical data on model splits for each traffic type.

  • modal_split_user_def (dict[TrafficType, dict[str, dict[TransportModal, [Datapoint]]]]) – The user defined model split points for each traffic type.

  • modal_ukm_energy_consumption (dict[TrafficType, dict[TransportModal, Demand]]) – The energy consumption for each pkm or tkm and each transport modal.

  • demand_split_reference (dict[TrafficType, dict[TransportModal, dict[DemandType, [Datapoint]]]]) – How demand should be split over time. Reference from real data.

  • demand_split_user (dict[TrafficType, dict[TransportModal, dict[DemandType, [Datapoint]]]]) –

How demand should be split over time. Defined by user.

endemo2.input_and_settings.input_utility module

class FileReadingHelper(file_name, sheet_name, skip_rows, sheet_transform)[source]

Bases: object

A helper class to read products historical data. It provides some fixed transformation operations.

Variables:

  • file_name (str) – The files name, relative to the path variable.

  • sheet_name (str) – The name of the sheet that is to be read from the file.

  • skip_rows ([int]) – These rows(!) will be skipped when reading the dataframe. Done by numerical index.

  • sheet_transform (lambda[pd.Dataframe -> pd.Dataframe]) – A transformation operation on the dataframe

  • df (pd.Dataframe) – The current dataframe.

  • path (Path) – The path to the folder, where the file is. It can to be set after constructing the FileReadingHelper Object.

Parameters:

  • file_name (str) –

  • sheet_name (str) –

  • skip_rows ([<class 'int'>]) –

get()[source]

Getter for the dataframe.

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

The current dataframe, which is filtered depending on previous function calls on this class.
